question: Who launched the Eklavya App?
option_2: Indian Army
option_3: Ministry of Skill Development
solution:
• The Eklavya App was launched by the Indian Army.
  • It is an online learning platform aimed at revolutionizing officer training.
  • This app is part of the Army's initiative to integrate modern technology into training programs, ensuring efficient and advanced learning methods for officers.
  • The platform also supports remote learning, making training accessible to officers stationed in different regions.

question: Who launched the RISE App (Rapid Immunization Skill Enhancement)?
option_2: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
solution:
• The RISE App was launched by the Uttar Pradesh Government.
  • It aims to ensure regular vaccination of children, especially in rural areas.
  • This app is designed to enhance the skills of healthcare workers in immunization practices, ensuring better coverage and efficiency in vaccination drives.
  • It also includes training modules and real-time monitoring tools to track vaccination progress and address challenges in remote regions.

question: Who launched the Elements App?
option_1: Prime Minister of India
option_2: Vice President of India
option_3: Ministry of Electronics and IT
option_4: Ministry of Home Affairs
solution:
• The Elements App was launched by the Vice President of India.
  • It is a desi social media app that provides features like audio/video calls, group chats, and other engagement tools.
  • The app promotes privacy-focused communication and aims to offer a homegrown alternative to global social media platforms.
  • It highlights the push for digital Atmanirbharta (self-reliance) in India's tech ecosystem.

question: Who launched the SwaRail Super App?
option_1: Ministry of Civil Aviation
option_2: NITI Aayog
solution:
• The SwaRail Super App was launched by the Ministry of Railways.
  • Its goal is to integrate multiple railway services like ticketing, tracking, catering, and information systems into one unified platform.
  • It supports digital convenience, providing passengers with end-to-end travel solutions from booking to post-travel feedback.
  • This initiative reflects the government's push for tech-enabled infrastructure and seamless rail passenger experience.

question: Which app launched by the Central Government in January 2024 to provide digital study materials in Indian languages?
option_2: SwaRail Super App
solution:
• The Anuvadini App was launched by the Central Government in January 2024.
  • It is an Artificial Intelligence-driven platform designed to offer digital study materials in various Indian languages.
  • The app aims to promote linguistic inclusivity and ensure that students across India have access to educational resources in their native languages.
  • This initiative supports the National Education Policy (NEP) by emphasizing the importance of learning in regional languages.

question: Which app was launched by the Election Commission of India for effective candidate and election management?
option_2: Anuvadini App
solution:
• The ENCORE App was launched by the Election Commission of India.
  • It is an in-house software designed to ensure streamlined candidate and election management.
  • The full form of ENCORE is Enabling Communications on Real-time Environment.
  • The app supports real-time communication, helping officials to manage electoral data, nomination details, and procedural updates efficiently.
  • This system enhances transparency and accuracy in election operations through digital integration.

question: Which app was launched by the Election Commission of India for citizens to report violations of the model code of conduct during elections?
option_2: Anuvadini App
solution:
• The cVIGIL App was launched by the Election Commission of India.
  • It is designed to empower citizens to report any violations of the model code of conduct during elections.
  • The app allows users to upload photos, videos, or descriptions of violations, which are then forwarded to election officials for action.
  • This initiative promotes transparency and ensures fair electoral practices by involving the public in monitoring election conduct.

question: Who launched the Lokpath Mobile App in July 2024 to help citizens report road-related issues?
option_2: Mohan Yadav
solution:
• The Lokpath Mobile App was launched in July 2024 by Mohan Yadav, the Minister of Madhya Pradesh.
  • This app provides the general public with a platform to report problems related to roads.
  • It also ensures accountability of officers by forwarding complaints for timely action.
  • The initiative aims to improve road infrastructure through citizen participation and transparent monitoring.

question: Who launched the Sangyaan App in June 2024 to provide RPF personnel with information on criminal laws?
option_2: Piyush Goyal
solution:
• The Sangyaan App was launched in June 2024 by DG RPF Manoj Yadav.
  • This app is designed to provide Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel with comprehensive information on both new and old criminal laws.
  • It aims to enhance the knowledge and efficiency of RPF personnel in handling legal matters and ensuring law enforcement.

question: Who launched the Meri Panchayat App on 21st August 2023 to empower citizens to actively participate in their Panchayats' functioning?
option_2: Giriraj Singh
solution:
• The Meri Panchayat App was launched on 21st August 2023 by Giriraj Singh, the Minister of Rural Development & Panchayati Raj.
  • This app provides a platform for citizens to actively engage in the functioning of their Panchayats, promoting transparency and participation in local governance.
  • It aims to strengthen the democratic process at the grassroots level.

question: What is the primary purpose of the Paat Mitro App launched by the Ministry of Textiles?
option_1: To provide weather updates to farmers
option_2: To give jute farmers vital information about MSP and agronomy
option_3: To promote the export of jute products
option_4: To connect farmers with textile industries
solution:
• The Paat Mitro App was launched by the Ministry of Textiles.
  • Its primary purpose is to provide jute farmers with essential information about Minimum Support Prices (MSP) and agronomy.
  • This initiative aims to support jute farmers by ensuring they have access to critical data for better decision-making and improved agricultural practices.

question: Who launched the SAKHI App for the astronauts of the Gaganyaan mission?
option_2: DRDO
solution:
• The SAKHI App was launched by VSSC (Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre).
  • It is designed specifically for the astronauts of the Gaganyaan mission.
  • The app will monitor the astronauts' health, help them stay connected with Earth, and even alert them about their dietary schedules.
  • This app is a critical step in ensuring the well-being and efficiency of astronauts during India's first human spaceflight mission.

question: Who launched the Maaptol Grievance App to facilitate the registration and redressal of consumer grievances?
option_1: Ministry of Consumer Affairs
option_2: Election Commission of India
option_4: Ministry of Electronics and IT
solution:
• The Maaptol Grievance App was launched by the National Informatics Centre (NIC).
  • Its primary purpose is to facilitate the registration and redressal of consumer grievances.
  • This app aims to empower consumers by providing them with a streamlined platform to address their concerns effectively.

question: Who launched the Saksham App to facilitate easier voting for persons with disabilities?
option_1: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
option_2: Election Commission of India (ECI)
option_4: Ministry of Law and Justice
solution:
• The Saksham App was launched by the Election Commission of India (ECI).
  • It is designed to facilitate easier voting for persons with disabilities.
  • This app ensures inclusivity in the electoral process by providing necessary assistance and accessibility features for voters with disabilities.

question: Who launched the Hello Ujjivan mobile banking app featuring Voice, Visual, and Vernacular-enabled features?
option_1: Reserve Bank of India (RBI)
option_2: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank
option_3: State Bank of India (SBI)
option_4: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)
solution:
• The Hello Ujjivan mobile banking app was launched by Ujjivan Small Finance Bank.
  • It is India's first mobile banking app featuring three-Vs: Voice, Visual, and Vernacular-enabled features.
  • The app is designed to provide banking access to people with limited reading and writing skills, ensuring inclusivity in financial services.
  • This innovative approach aims to empower individuals by making banking services accessible to all, regardless of literacy levels.

question: Who launched the Khanan Prahari App to detect and act against illegal coal mining activities?
option_1: Ministry of Coal, Government of India
option_2: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
option_4: Election Commission of India (ECI)
solution:
• The Khanan Prahari App was launched by the Ministry of Coal, Government of India.
  • The app enables citizen participation by allowing them to report illegal mining activities through the mobile app.
  • It is designed to monitor and take action on any kind of illegal coal mining activity being carried out within the leasehold areas.
  • This initiative ensures transparency and accountability in coal mining operations.

question: Who launched the Prahari App for proactive governance facility?
option_2: Border Security Force (BSF) & Ministry of Home Affairs
option_4: Election Commission of India (ECI)
solution:
• The Prahari App was launched by the Border Security Force (BSF) in collaboration with the Ministry of Home Affairs.
  • The app is designed to provide a proactive governance facility, enabling better coordination and management of border security operations.
  • It aims to enhance transparency and efficiency in governance related to border security.

question: Which app was launched by the Principal Scientific Adviser to address mental health and promote normalcy augmentation?
option_2: MANAS App
solution:
• The MANAS App was launched by the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India.
  • MANAS stands for Mental Health and Normalcy Augmentation System.
  • The app is designed to promote mental well-being and provide support for individuals to maintain normalcy in their lives.
  • It integrates various scientific and psychological tools to enhance mental health.

question: Which state government launched the Fishwale App, India’s first e-fish market app?
option_2: Government of Assam
solution:
• The Fishwale App was launched by the Government of Assam.
  • It is India’s first e-fish market app, designed to eliminate the role of intermediaries in fisheries.
  • The app ensures that fish farmers and buyers can directly connect, promoting transparency and fair pricing.

question: Which app was launched by the Government of Gujarat to make administrative tasks paperless?
option_2: Digital India App
solution:
• The e-Sarkar App was launched by the Government of Gujarat.
  • The app aims to make administrative tasks paperless, promoting efficiency and reducing the use of physical resources.
  • It is part of the government’s initiative to digitize governance and improve transparency.

question: Which app has been launched by the Union Ministry of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj to enhance MNREGA transparency across India?
option_2: MNREGA Suraksha App
solution:
• The Lokpal App was launched by the Union Ministry of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj.
  • Its objective is to make MNREGA operations more transparent across all states and union territories.
  • It helps in identifying grievances and ensures timely redressal related to MNREGA implementation.

question: Which app launched by the Election Commission of India aims to directly map all polling stations for faster and more transparent electoral operations?
option_2: Garuda App
solution:
• The Garuda App has been launched by the Election Commission of India.
  • It is designed for direct mapping of polling stations, speeding up the electoral process and improving transparency.
  • The app also facilitates digital verification and resource management during elections.

question: Which organization launched the SAARTHI mobile app to provide accurate information to investors about mutual funds, trading, and KYC?
option_1: Reserve Bank of India (RBI)
option_2: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI)
solution:
• The SAARTHI mobile app was launched by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI).
  • It aims to provide accurate and reliable information to investors about mutual funds, market trading, and KYC processes.
  • The app is part of SEBI's initiative to enhance investor awareness and protect their interests.

question: Which organization launched the ABHA mobile app to link health records created at ABDM-compliant health facilities and allow users to view them on smartphones?
option_1: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
option_2: National Health Authority
option_3: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR)
solution:
• The ABHA mobile app was launched by the National Health Authority.
  • It enables users to link their health records created at ABDM-compliant health facilities and access them conveniently on their smartphones.
  • The app is part of the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM), aiming to digitize healthcare services and improve accessibility.

question: Which ministry launched the Jaldoot app to track water levels in wells across villages?
option_1: Ministry of Jal Shakti
option_2: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
option_3: Ministry of Rural Development
option_4: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
solution:
• The Jaldoot app was launched by the Ministry of Rural Development.
  • Its primary purpose is to monitor and track water levels in wells across villages, helping in water conservation and management efforts.
  • The app is part of the government's initiative to address water scarcity in rural areas.

question: Which app was launched by Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan to promote employment opportunities and skill development in the leather industry?
option_2: SCALE App
solution:
• The SCALE App was launched by Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan.
  • It focuses on providing employment opportunities and enhancing skill development in the leather industry.
  • The app aims to bridge the gap between skilled workers and employers in this sector, contributing to economic growth.

question: Which organization launched the SUVAS app to promote regional languages in judicial procedures?
option_1: Supreme Court of India
option_2: Ministry of Law and Justice
option_3: Bar Council of India
solution:
• The SUVAS app was launched by the Supreme Court of India.
  • It aims to promote the use of regional languages in judicial procedures, making legal processes more accessible to the general public.
  • The app is part of the Supreme Court's initiative to enhance inclusivity and bridge language barriers in the judiciary.

question: Which ministry launched the E-Chhawani app to provide online civic services to the residents of cantonment boards across India?
option_2: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
option_3: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
option_4: Ministry of Home Affairs
solution:
• The E-Chhawani app was launched by the Ministry of Defence.
  • It aims to provide online civic services to residents of cantonment boards across India, ensuring better governance and accessibility.
  • The app is part of the government's initiative to digitize public services and improve the quality of life for residents in cantonment areas.

question: Which government launched the Mobile-Dost app to enhance accessibility and convenience for its residents?
option_2: Himachal Pradesh Government
solution:
• The Mobile-Dost app was launched by the Jammu & Kashmir Government.
  • It aims to ensure that every individual in Jammu & Kashmir can access government services conveniently at their fingertips.
  • The app is part of the government's initiative to improve service delivery and make governance more citizen-centric.

question: Who launched the ULLAS initiative?
option_2: Narendra Modi
solution:
• The ULLAS initiative was launched by Dharmendra Pradhan, who is the Union Minister of Education and Minister of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship.
  • The initiative aims to facilitate widespread access to basic literacy, ensuring that individuals can acquire fundamental reading and writing skills.
  • It is part of the government's efforts to promote inclusive education and improve literacy rates across the country.

question: Which organization launched the BHARATPOL portal?
option_2: RBI
option_3: Ministry of Home Affairs
solution:
• The BHARATPOL portal was launched by the CBI (Central Bureau of Investigation).
  • It aims to enhance the efficiency of Indian investigation agencies in tracking fugitives and facilitating faster international assistance.
  • This portal is a significant step toward improving cross-border cooperation in criminal investigations.

question: Which organization launched the RBIDATA portal?
option_2: SEBI
solution:
• The RBIDATA portal was launched by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).
  • It provides macroeconomic and financial statistics-related data about the Indian economy.
  • This portal is a valuable resource for researchers, policymakers, and analysts to access comprehensive economic data.

question: Who launched the Ideas4LiFE Portal?
option_2: Ministry of Science and Technology
option_3: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
option_4: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
solution:
• The Ideas4LiFE Portal was launched by Shri Bhupender Yadav, Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change.
  • The portal invites ideas related to environment-friendly lifestyles, promoting behavioral change.
  • It supports the mission of LiFE—Lifestyle for Environment, encouraging sustainable practices.

question: What is the main objective of the NATS 2.0 portal?
option_2: Encouraging foreign investment
option_3: Democratizing apprenticeship and skill-building
solution:
• The NATS 2.0 (National Apprenticeship and Training Scheme 2.0) was launched by Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, Union Minister for Education.
  • It aims to democratize apprenticeship, bridge the skill gap, and prepare youth for future workforce needs.
  • A transformative step in empowering youth and aligning training with industry demands.

question: Which ministry launched the SHe-Box Portal?
option_1: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
option_2: Ministry of Women and Child Development
option_3: Ministry of Labour and Employment
option_4: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
solution:
• The SHe-Box Portal was launched by the Ministry of Women and Child Development, under the leadership of Annapurna Devi.
  • It aims to enhance the implementation of the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition, and Redressal) Act, 2013, providing a platform for women to report workplace harassment.

question: Who launched the SWATI Portal?
option_1: Ministry of Science and Technology
option_2: Principal Scientific Advisor to the Government
option_3: Ministry of Women and Child Development
solution:
• The SWATI Portal was launched by Prof. Ajay Kumar Sood, the Principal Scientific Advisor to the Government.
  • It serves as a gateway to showcase the expertise and contributions of Indian women in science, marking the 75th year of Indian Independence as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav.
  • This initiative highlights the achievements of women in science and their role in India's progress.

question: PM-SURAJ Portal has been launched for whom?
option_1: Entrepreneurs from disadvantaged communities
option_2: Farmers in rural areas
solution:
• The PM-SURAJ Portal stands for Pradhan Mantri Samajik Utthan Evam Rozgar Adharit Jankalyan.
  • It aims to provide credit assistance to one lakh entrepreneurs from disadvantaged communities, supporting their social upliftment and employment generation.
  • This initiative is a step towards empowering marginalized sections of society.

question: E-Shram Portal has been launched for whom?
option_2: Unorganised workers
solution:
• The E-Shram Portal is a One Stop Solution Portal launched by the Ministry of Labour & Employment.
  • It simplifies the registration process for unorganised workers and facilitates their access to government welfare schemes.
  • This initiative ensures that unorganised workers can avail benefits like social security and financial assistance.

question: National Crop Insurance Portal (NCIP) has been launched by whom?
option_1: Ministry of Labour & Employment
option_2: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
option_3: Ministry of Rural Development
solution:
• The National Crop Insurance Portal (NCIP) has been launched by the Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare.
  • It is designed to enable farmers to receive their PMFBY (Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana) claim amounts in a time-bound and automated manner.
  • This initiative ensures transparency and efficiency in crop insurance claim disbursement, directly benefiting farmers.

question: The One Family One ID Portal has been launched by which government?
option_2: Government of Uttar Pradesh
solution:
• The One Family One ID Portal has been launched by the Uttar Pradesh Government.
  • It aims to identify families as a unit to implement the ‘One Family One Job’ scheme, ensuring targeted benefits for families.

question: The iDEEKSHA portal has been launched by whom?
option_1: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
option_2: Union Minister of Power
option_3: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
option_4: Ministry of Science and Technology
solution:
• The iDEEKSHA portal has been launched by the Union Minister of Power.
  • It is part of the Voluntary Star Labelling Programme for multi-door refrigerators, table and wall-mounted fans, and pedestal fans, promoting energy efficiency.

question: The SAANS portal has been launched by which government?
option_2: Government of Bihar
option_4: Government of West Bengal
solution:
• The SAANS portal was launched by the Government of Assam.
  • Its aim is to prevent neonatal deaths by enabling timely interventions and improving newborn healthcare delivery.
  • It helps in monitoring infant health data and acts as a digital resource to coordinate efforts across health departments and districts.
  • This initiative supports the broader goal of reducing infant mortality and enhancing maternal care services.

question: The CM DA Hesi portal has been launched by whom?
option_1: Chief Minister of Nagaland
option_2: Chief Minister of Manipur
option_3: Chief Minister of Assam
option_4: Chief Minister of Meghalaya
solution:
• The CM DA Hesi Portal was launched by the Chief Minister of Manipur.
  • It is designed to address public grievances directly through a centralized digital platform.
  • Citizens can submit complaints and track status efficiently, enabling improved transparency and accountability in governance.
  • The portal strengthens the state's effort to ensure inclusive and responsive administration.

question: The Sambhav portal has been launched by which government?
option_2: Government of Uttar Pradesh
option_3: Government of Madhya Pradesh
solution:
• The Sambhav Portal was launched by the Government of Uttar Pradesh.
  • It serves as a comprehensive platform for public grievances, monitoring of government programs, and redressal of scheme-related issues.
  • The portal ensures citizen feedback is acknowledged and processed with improved tracking mechanisms.
  • It reflects the government's commitment to accountable and transparent governance, offering real-time resolution support.

question: Which ministry launched the SACRED portal to promote employment opportunities for senior citizens?
option_1: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
option_2: Ministry of Labour and Employment
option_3: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
option_4: Ministry of Rural Development
solution:
• The SACRED portal stands for Senior Able Citizens for Re-Employment in Dignity.
  • It was launched by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.
  • The platform connects skilled senior citizens with employers, providing them opportunities to contribute meaningfully even after retirement.
  • This initiative promotes dignity, inclusion, and productive aging, strengthening social support systems for the elderly.

question: What is the purpose of the PRANA portal launched by the Union Ministry of Environment, Forests, and Climate Change?
option_2: Plastic waste management
option_3: Regulation of air pollution and public access to air quality data
solution:
• The PRANA portal stands for Portal for Regulation of Air Pollution in Non-Attainment cities.
  • It was developed by the Ministry of Environment, Forests, and Climate Change.
  • It provides air pollution data, monitors progress of action plans, and supports transparency in air quality management.
  • Citizens can use it to access city-specific air quality information and government steps to improve environmental conditions.

question: What is the primary purpose of the UDGAM portal launched by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI)?
option_1: To track inflation trends
option_2: To monitor foreign exchange reserves
option_3: To search for unclaimed bank deposits
option_4: To regulate digital lending platforms
solution:
• UDGAM stands for Unclaimed Deposits – Gateway to Access Information.
  • It is a centralized web portal developed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).
  • The portal enables citizens to search for unclaimed deposits across multiple banks in one place.
  • It covers deposits transferred to the Depositor Education and Awareness (DEA) Fund and currently includes over 30 banks, representing around 90% of unclaimed deposits.
  • Users must register with their name and mobile number, and can search using details like PAN, date of birth, or voter ID.
  • The portal promotes transparency, financial inclusion, and helps individuals reclaim forgotten funds.

question: What is the objective of the NIRMAN Portal launched by the Union Government?
option_1: Skill development for rural youth
option_2: Financial support for UPSC aspirants
option_3: Infrastructure monitoring in coal districts
option_4: Online registration for construction workers
solution:
• NIRMAN stands for Noble Initiative for Rewarding Mains Aspirants of National Civil Services Examination.
  • It was launched by Union Minister G. Kishan Reddy under the Ministry of Coal, as a CSR initiative by Coal India Limited (CIL).
  • The portal provides ₹1,00,000 financial support to meritorious candidates who qualified the UPSC Preliminary Exam (Civil Services & Forest Services) in 2024.
  • Eligibility includes:
    • Annual family income less than ₹8 lakhs
    • Belonging to SC/ST, female, or third gender categories
    • Permanent residents of Coal India’s 39 operational districts
  • The portal ensures transparency and digital empowerment, aligning with Digital India and Mission Karmayogi.

question: The Yuva Sangam Portal has been launched under which national initiative?
option_2: Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat
solution:
• The Yuva Sangam Portal is part of the Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat (EBSB) initiative by the Ministry of Education.
  • It aims to strengthen people-to-people connections among youth from different states and union territories.
  • Youth aged 18–30 years (students, NSS/NYKS volunteers, employed/self-employed) can register to participate in educational and cultural exposure tours.
  • Participants gain immersive experiences across five dimensions known as the 5 Ps:
    • Paryatan (Tourism)
    • Parampara (Traditions)
    • Pragati (Development)
    • Paraspar Sampark (People-to-people connect)
    • Prodyogiki (Technology)
  • The portal supports national integration, experiential learning, and aligns with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.

question: What is the primary objective of the ShaGun Portal launched by the Ministry of Education?
option_2: Monitoring higher education institutions
option_3: Integrated platform for school education quality and data transparency
option_4: Digital certification for vocational training
solution:
• ShaGun Portal is an initiative by the Department of School Education and Literacy, under the Ministry of Education.
  • The name ShaGun is derived from ‘Shala’ (School) and ‘Gunvatta’ (Quality).
  • It serves as an Integrated Online Junction for school education, combining multiple portals and websites into one platform.
  • The portal has two key components:
    • A repository of best practices, success stories, videos, and articles from schools across India.
    • A monitoring dashboard that tracks state-level performance on key educational indicators.
  • It covers over 3 lakh educational websites, connects 92 lakh teachers and 26 crore students, and provides report cards of 15 lakh schools.
  • The portal promotes transparency, accountability, and data-driven policy interventions in school education.
